socialmedia

Class Post<T extends User>

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialmedia.Post<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of user associated with the post
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FacebookPost, TumblrPost, TwitterPost

    public abstract class Post<T extends User>
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class of posts. These fields are what the different platforms have in common. It gets created with what type of user the post is associated with. For instance FacebookUser.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Post.Type
      The post types that a post may be Post.Type.IMAGE Post.Type.TEXT Post.Type.VIDEO Post.Type.LINK Post.Type.OFFER

      • getType

        public Post.Type getType()
        Returns the type of the post. If the post is a text, video, image, link post etc.
        Returns:
        type of post

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the body text of the post. time must be in UTC, or the result will be incorrect
        Parameters:
        text - Body text

      • setCreationTime

        public void setCreationTime(java.util.Date time)
        Sets the creation time using a java.util.Date This will internally be converted to a ZonedDateTime As java.util.Date lacks a timezone, this function assumes the timezone is UTC.
        Parameters:
        time - Creation time of the post

      • getCreationTime

        public java.time.ZonedDateTime getCreationTime()
        Gets a copy of the time when the post was first created.
        Returns:
        Creation time

      • setCreationTime

        public void setCreationTime(java.time.ZonedDateTime time)
        Sets the time when the post was first created. The passed time is copied before storing
        Parameters:
        time - Creation time

      • getEditTime

        public java.time.ZonedDateTime getEditTime()
        Gets the time when the post was last changed. If the post has never been changed, will return the creation time.
        Returns:
        Edit time

      • setEditTime

        public void setEditTime(java.time.ZonedDateTime time)
        Sets the time when the post was last changed. If the post has never been changed, this should be set to the creation time.
        Parameters:
        time - Edit time

      • setEditTime

        public void setEditTime(java.util.Date time)
        Sets the creation time using a java.util.Date This will internally be converted to a ZonedDateTime As java.util.Date lacks a timezone, this function assumes the timezone is UTC.
        Parameters:
        time - Creation time of the post

      • getSharedCount

        public int getSharedCount()
        Gets the amount of times the post has been shared. Shares is counted in some way that makes sense to individual networks.
        Returns:
        Shares count

      • setSharedCount

        public void setSharedCount(int count)
        Sets the amount of times the post has been shared.
        Parameters:
        count - Shares count

      • getTo

        public java.lang.Iterable<T> getTo()
        Sets the list of users the post was directed to. What is considered a "to" depends on the network.
        Returns:
        Iterable of users

      • setTo

        Sets the list of users the post was directed to.
        Parameters:

      • getTags
